snippet: Even as the Securities and Exchange Commission has stepped up its investigations of Wall Street, the agency has repeatedly allowed the biggest firms to avoid punishments.
abstract: Securities and Exchange Commission has stepped up its investigations of Wall Street in the last decade, but the agency has repeatedly allowed the biggest firms to avoid punishments specifically meant to apply to fraud cases; by granting exemptions to laws and regulations that act as a deterrent to securities fraud, the SEC has let financial giants continue to have advantages, making it easier for them to raise money from investors, for example, and to avoid liability from lawsuits if their financial forecasts turn out to be wrong.
lead_paragraph: Even as the Securities and Exchange Commission has stepped up its investigations of Wall Street, the agency has repeatedly allowed the biggest firms to avoid punishments.

headline.seo: S.E.C. Is Avoiding Tough Sanctions for Large Banks
headline.main: S.E.C. Is Avoiding Tough Sanctions for Large Banks
headline.print_headline: S.E.C. Is Avoiding Tough Sanctions For Large Banks
